title: Definitions
context: PART VI. VICTIMS PROTECTIONS Note Part heading amended by L 2011, c 206, ยง3(1). [A.] General Provisions Note Section 378-71 designated as Subpart A by L 2011, c 206, ยง3(2). [ยง378-71] Definitions. As used in this part: &ldquo;Child&rdquo; means an individual who is a biological, adopted, or foster son or daughter; a stepchild; or a legal ward of an employee. &ldquo;Course of conduct&rdquo; means acts over any period of time of repeatedly maintaining a visual or physical proximity to a person or conveying verbal or written threats, including threats conveyed through electronic communications or threats implied by conduct. &ldquo;Domestic abuse&rdquo; means conduct defined in section 586-1. &ldquo;Domestic or sexual violence&rdquo; means domestic abuse, sexual assault, or stalking. &ldquo;Electronic communications&rdquo; includes communications via telephone, mobile phone, computer, e-mail, video recorder, fax machine, telex, or pager. &ldquo;Employee&rdquo; means a person who performs services for hire for not fewer than six consecutive months for the employer from whom benefits are sought under this chapter. &ldquo;Health care provider&rdquo; means a physician as defined under section 386-1. &ldquo;Sexual assault&rdquo; means any conduct proscribed by chapter 707, part V. &ldquo;Stalking&rdquo; means engaging in a course of conduct directed at a specifically targeted person that would cause a reasonable person to suffer substantial emotional distress or to fear bodily injury, sexual assault, or death to the person or to the person&rsquo;s spouse, parent, child, or any other person who regularly resides in the person&rsquo;s household, and where the conduct does cause the targeted person to have such distress or fear. &ldquo;Victim services organization&rdquo; includes: (1) A nonprofit, nongovernmental organization that provides assistance to victims of domestic or sexual violence or to advocates for such victims, including a rape crisis center; (2) An organization operating a shelter or providing professional counseling services; or (3) An organization providing assistance through the legal process.
